messages.message: In the converse update API, it looks like name cannot contain any spaces. Why is the reason for that?

Are you looking for a way to update the name of the existing conversation?

If so, I am able to update the name using the below code.


`# Update an existing Conversation`
`def update_conversation(conversation_id: Text, name: Text, description: Text) -> Response:`
  `response = requests.put(f'{url}/{conversation_id}?name={name}&description={description}', headers=API_HEADERS)`
  `return response`

`conversation_id = 'c33792ab-a0d5-4642-a8eb-1cad9a4d9c8c'`
`name = 'updated name'`
`description = 'updated description'`
`response = update_conversation(conversation_id, name, description)`
`print (response)`
`if response.ok:`
  `print(f'Updated the conversation: {response}')`

Developer Guide for Converse APIs:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jcaAPmC7azkUWZeY0P4rRYPi2186s8Umf41JC4V8Hwo/edit
Nvm i do not know why before it was not accepting a name update with a space in it. It now works for me
